intro: Triraphis, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be annual or perennial, depending on the species. They are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Triraphis species often grow in moist, disturbed soils and are found in various regions across the Northern Hemisphere. Their botanical features make them adaptable to a range of environmental conditions.
